questions.text: In the beginning of the episode, how many dates have George and Betsy been on?
questions.explanation:
Nine.

	Jerry is worried that he and Sidra may never get anywhere in a relationship because of George's current situation.  On each date that George has with Betsy, something goes wrong, and he can't make a move.  For example, she's always sitting on his 'wrong side'.  If he's on the right side, then he's able to make a move with his left hand, and things go along a lot more smoothly.  Betsy is played by Megan Mullally who is well known for her role on the TV show "Will and Grace".

questions.text: Which one of Betsy's relatives dies during this episode?
questions.explanation:
aunt.

	While on a date, George tries to stop Betsy from answering the phone so that he can make a move on her, but she answers it thinking that it could possibly be an emergency.  It really is an emergency, and she finds out that her Aunt Clarice has just died.

questions.text: What does Kramer miss about Los Angeles?
questions.explanation:
warm weather.

	Jerry is concerned that Sidra's breasts are actually implants after Elaine says that they are, and he says that he always wondered what implants feel like.  Kramer says that he had the experience of feeling implants when he was living in Los Angeles.Kramer lived in Los Angeles between the third and fourth seasons of the show, from the episode "The Keys", to the episode "The Trip (Part 2)".Sidra is played by actress Teri Hatcher, who is also on the hit show "Desperate Housewives".

questions.text: According to Jerry and Kramer, what 'guy' is George when Betsy's relative dies?
questions.explanation:
The consolation guy.

	Jerry mentions this in the sauna at the health club.  George is doubtful that the relationship between himself and Betsy will work, but the guys give him support.  Kramer says that being 'the consolation guy' is like having ten dates in one, because he's there to comfort Betsy during the tragedy.

questions.text: Where is the funeral for Betsy's relative?
questions.explanation:
Detroit.

	When George says that he's going to the funeral, he says that he's worried about paying for a plane ticket, but Kramer suggests going for the 'Death in the Family' ticket fare which will knock off fifty percent of the ticket price.  He says that he might actually buy the ticket so that he can get the frequent flier miles, and George can get to Detroit for a quarter of the price.

questions.text: What is the name of Sidra's friend when Elaine meets her in the sauna?
questions.explanation:
Marcie.

	Elaine can't help but overhear Sidra talking about how Jerry stood her up, and she acts like she doesn't know who he is.  They end up formally meeting each other, but when Elaine goes over to Sidra for a handshake, she trips and falls into her breasts.  She later tells Jerry that they aren't implants.

questions.text: What does George need to bring to the airport in order to get money back for his flight ticket?
questions.explanation:
death certificate.

	In order for George to get the 'Death in the Family' fare, he needs to ask Betsy for the death certificate of her aunt.  He ends up going on the trip anyways in order to console Betsy, but he still asks for the death certificate.

questions.text: After helping George, where does Kramer decide to go on vacation?
questions.explanation:
Puerto Rico.

	Kramer decides to fly down to Puerto Rico for the warm weather since he misses the weather in Los Angeles so much.  He ends up getting double the frequent flier miles because he paid for both George's ticket and his own.

questions.text: What is the name of Betsy's brother?
questions.explanation:
Timmy.

	George ends up meeting Betsy's aunt, and brother at the funeral, and he ends up asking the priest for the death certificate.In New York, Jerry goes on his final date with Sidra and she realizes that Jerry knows Elaine.  She ends up leaving and she tells Jerry that she doesn't have implants.

questions.text: George 'double dips' the chip in this episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	George does this at the funeral when he realizes he might be able to pull off his cheap plane ticket plan.  When Timmy catches him doing it, he ends up doing it a second time, and they get into a fight.  Betsy breaks up with George, and he doesn't get his flight discount.
